Word.EngDesc: The a (ั) is pronounced like in bar, car or cut
The æ (แ) is pronounced like (british) bag, care or Rabbit
The ai (ใ) is pronounced like in die, eye or Thai
The am (ำ) is pronounced like in (british) rum
The e is (เ) pronounced like in get, jet, let
The ea (เีย) is pronounced like in beer, dear, gear.ร์ is not pronounced following the rules to closing sounds
The ee ี is pronounced like in bee, sea
The ee (เ) is pronounced like in bread, dead
The g (ก) is pronounced like in get, go, grand
The h (ห) is pronounced like in hand, hard
the i (ิ) is pronounced like in bit, Italy, sit
The o (โ) is pronounced like in hope, toe, tone
The eer (เิ) is pronounced like in Bird, Burn, term, girl
The aaw (อ) is pronounced like in aunt, ball, dog
The oo (ุ) is pronounced like in butcher, put
The y is pronounced like in year, yes
The uaa (ัว) is pronounced like in tour, poor

Simply has to be practised with sound

[numerical classifier for dishes (including satellite)]

[numerical classifier for royally enrolled elephants]

headress used in Thai classical dancing and theater
[linguistics] origin of alphabet/Words, [adv] on the basis of
[a character in the Ramanyana epic,] the wife of a giant
elder, respected old and wise person
[typically] below the age of twenty; title used to refer to a novice
[fig.] a young person working in a subservient occupation
[adv] slowly; at a leisurely pace
[numerical classifier for condoms, cysts, bags, pouches]

[fairly impolite 2nd person pronoun used to call over a waitress in a restaurant and a girl or woman working in a nightclub, café or escort business] you, [1st person pronoun that a little girl, daughter or grown-up woman uses to refer to herself in a cute way, usually when speaking to her parents or elder relatives] I, myself, [2nd person pronoun used for calling a little girl or boy (usually หนู + the child's nickname) and implying the speaker's tender feeling towards the child] you, little boy, little girl, [1st person pronoun that a female servant and country girl or woman uses to to refer to herself when speaking to anyone] I, myself
leaf of a tree
[n, prop.n, colloq] year or zodiac sign of the Fish
lid or cover of a pot or bowl; cap, interior wall
tray on which items are offered to a Buddhist monk, to foul by entangling; to lasso; to scrape up against; to interact with

to cut with downward blow, as with an axe or other sharp object, to struggle against or contend with, to work at doing something in order to get something accomplished or fix the situation, to overcharge; scam; rip off
[certain type of] small sailing vessel used in Asia and Southeast Asia; junk; argosy
[a character from the Ramayana epic, a] giant [or] demon
[chess] the rook
a ring (worn on the finger), a circular metal washer
meeting hall (in a temple)
ascetic; meditating recluse or hermit
excellent; ravishing; beautiful; delicate
[of speech] [is] stuttering; stammering, [numerical classifier for sinks, basins, bathtubs], [sound of a] bullfrog
oriental barn owl
There are 3 closing sounds called stop sounds
ั is pronounced as an short a.
-า is pronounced as a long a.
แ-ะ is pronounced like a short æ.
Pronounced as a long æ.
เ-ะ is pronounced like a short e.
เ- is pronounced as a long e. [numerical classifier for songs]
ิ is pronounced as a short i. to think (that...), to charge (a price)
pronounced like a long i or e. after a time; still, another; additional; more, against; next to, any more
โ-ะ is pronounced as a shot o.
โ- is pronounced as a long o.
เ-าะ is pronounced as a quick aw.
อ is pronounced as a longer aaw, [is] prone
เ-อะ is pronounced as ø or ö.
เ-อ is pronounced as a long ö, o forget; make a mistake
ุ is pronounced as a low oo.

ู is pronounced as a falling uu. child; offspring; son or daughter [including figurative usage for certain ideas]; cub; young animal, small ball; bulbous object; small round object; shortened form of ลูกบอล [e.g. football or football shot]
ึ is pronounced as a high eu
ื pronounced as a normal tone uu.
ไ- is pronounced as ai, ไม่ is pronounced with a falling tone. [auxiliary verb] does not; has not; is not
ใ- is pronounced as ai.
ำ is pronounced as am. to do or perform an action; to cause or effect a result, to make, produce, or implement (i.e. something tangible)
เ-า is pronounced as ao. [the singular pronoun] I, me [see examples], [the second person pronoun] you [see example]
เียะ is pronounced as ia.
เีย is pronounced as iia.

ัว is pronounced as ua. [of a person] self; himself; herself; yourself; themselves; [things] itself [of an insect or animal, or of a human carnally] a body [of an object] entity; item; body [orthography] number; digit; character; figure [2nd person pronoun, calling someone in a cute way] you [Thai prefix meaning] "doer"; [as in the English suffix] "-er" or "-or" (theatrical) character; (sports) player one (generic word [e.g. the small one]) [numerical classifier for digits, number, bodies, shirts, pants, suits, animals, fish, germs, chairs, tables, desks, software title]
ัวะ is pronounced as ua. ผลัวะ means[onomatopoeic sound of a rock thrown into a bush or a flock of birds flying from a thicket]
เือะ is pronounced as eua. เอือะ is the Thai vowel sound.
เือ is pronounced as euua.
[ancient spelling of] ลือชา.
Uncommon vowel with luu or lüü sound.
ฤ is pronounced as rü. ฤทธ์ also means thriving; growing; rich; increasing
ฤๅ is pronoun as reuu.
-อย is pronounced as aawy or åi.
เ็ว is pronounced as eo. [is] early
เียว is prononounced as iow or iaao. [is] early, turn to do something, to party; to go out partying, [numerical classifier for trips]
เืยว is pronounced as üai or uuay.
ิว is pronounced as iu. [is] hungry.
ุย is pronounced as ui or uy.

EngWords.string: Words never stop with any of these.

Word.EngDesc: These 8 letters never occure at the end of a word.
These 4 letters changes the sound น (no) if at the end of a word.
The three kho sounds changes into a K (The consonant ก changes sound from g to k at the end of a word).
The three sounds for ph- turns into pho or bo
The four d sounds mostly keep their sound or turn into dt-
The letters with the sounds j, t, s, and ch turn into dt.
In most cases the long vowel เออ changes to เิ when followed by another consonant. Therfor yuo should not write it as เดอน.
This word has the symbol ็ above the consonant, and indicates that the vowel is short.
This word is hard to read for a foreigner as it only contains consonants, but in Thai ther are often a unwritten vowel with either the sound a or o.
To say this word (and many other words) you say an o between the consonants.
To say this word (and many other words) you say an o between the consonants.
Sometimes you have to add an additional a between consonants.
Sometimes you have to add an additional a between consonants.
There are many words where the a is written.
There are many words where the a is written.

There are a few words with an additional aaw

Consonant is of the normal tone class and has a short vowel, making the word pronounced with a low tone.
Consonant is of the normal tone class and has a stop sound, making the word pronounced with a low tone.
This is the thai name of this symbol. It is placed above the consonant and indicates that the vowel has to be pronounced short.
To pronounce this word you need to add an additional o between ม and ก.
Consonant is of the normal tone class and has a long vowel sound, making the word pronounced with a normal tone.
Consonant is of the normal tone class and has a nasal sound, making the word pronounced with a normal tone.

Thai transcription of the foreign loanword. Consonant is of the high tone class and has a stop sound, making the word pronounced with a low tone.
Consonant is of the high tone class and has a long vowel, making the word pronounced with a rising tone.

When the initial consonant is a low tone, the tone mark indicates this tone for the word.

This mark has two names and it indicates that the consonant is silent and not pronounced.
This mark indicates repetition. The word is said twice which is important for the plkural or emphasize of things.
This mark indicates what should follow is understod. E.g. Bangkok, the 'City of Angels'.
This mark has the same meaning as so on or et cetera.

The thai days are named after the planets, monday is named after the moon. Simply translated monday in thai is day of the moon.
The thai days are named after the planets, tuesday is named after mars. Simply translated tuesday in thai is day of mars.
The thai days are named after the planets, tuesday is named after Mercury . Simply translated wednesday in thai is day of Mercury .

Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, thursday is named after Jupiter . Simply translated thursday in thai is day of Jupiter.
The thai days are named after the planets, friday is named after venus. Simply translated friday in thai is day of Venus.
The thai days are named after the planets, saturday is named after Saturn. Simply translated saturday in thai is day of Saturn.

ThaiScript.string: วันอาทิตย์

Word.EngDesc: The thai days are named after the planets, Sunday is named after the sun. simply translated sunday in thai is day of the sun.

Word.EngDesc: Words like ผม change their meaing based on the context. A woman says that she has beautiful hair like this, quite diffrently from a man.
The word for wall is diffrent based on the context. this is the sound of a wall outside.
The word for wall is diffrent based on the context. this is the sound of a wall inside.
